page.title: 01Scaleby and Laversdale
page.content: {Scaleby} is a village which straggles along a minor road 10 km. north east of{Carlisle}as well as including a hamlet at{Scaleby Hill}three quarters of a kilometre to the north. The name Scaleby is Norse and means a collection of huts. {Laversdale}is also a hamlet. It is 12 km. north east of Carlisle on minor road between the A6071 and the B6264 roads. Nearly all the land is used for farming and there are few amenities but a number of activities continue. {Scaleby} is on a ridge of rising ground to the north of Brunstock Beck which is a tributary of the River Eden. {Laversdale}is south east of Highberries Beck which in turn flows onto Brunstock Beck.
